dcterms:creator: Rozhin Yasaei
et al.
dcterms:description: GNN4IP is a GNN-based IP piracy detection technique that evaluates the similarity between two circuits by converting them into a graph representation and using GCNs to obtain graph embeddings, which are passed through a fully connected layer that outputs a similarity score.
dcterms:title: GNN4IP

dcterms:creator: Hazem Lashen
et al.
dcterms:description: TrojanSAINT is a GNN-based hardware Trojan localization technique that classifies each node in a circuit's graph representation as HT-free or HT-infested, helping to determine the location of hardware Trojans.
dcterms:title: TrojanSAINT

dcterms:creator: Lilas Alrahis
et al.
dcterms:description: GNN-RE is a GNN-based technique for reverse engineering circuits that classifies gates into different modules/classes such as adders, multipliers, and control logic using graph representations.
dcterms:title: GNN-RE

dcterms:creator: Lilas Alrahis
et al.
dcterms:description: OMLA is a GNN-based attack on hardware obfuscation that uses structural information around key-controlled gates to recover the correct key bits, thus breaking the security offered by the obfuscation.
dcterms:title: OMLA

dcterms:creator: Rozhin Yasaei
et al.
dcterms:description: GNN4TJ is a GNN-based detection technique targeting hardware Trojans inserted in third-party IPs, converting circuits into graph representations and using GCNs to classify circuits as HT-infested or not.
dcterms:title: GNN4TJ

dcterms:creator: Alan Mishchenko
et al.
dcterms:description: ABC is a system for sequential synthesis and verification that provides various functionalities for circuit design and analysis.
dcterms:title: ABC

dcterms:creator: AICPS
dcterms:description: HW2VEC is a graph learning tool designed for automating hardware security tasks.
dcterms:title: HW2VEC

dcterms:creator: Trust-Hub
dcterms:description: TrustHub is a repository of real-world circuits with various hardware Trojans that can be used for research and evaluation.
dcterms:title: TrustHub
